title: Capacitors - rank U for capacitors 1 2 and 3

content.question:
Area of Each Plate
Distance Between Plates
Potential Difference

Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="10 centimeters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi>cm</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="0.10 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
<math alttext="4.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

Capacitor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="10 centimeters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi>cm</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="0.20 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
<math alttext="2.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

Capacitor <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>

<math alttext="20 centimeters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi>cm</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="0.10 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>
<math alttext="4.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>

Three air-filled, parallel-plate capacitors have the dimensions shown in the table. The table also indicates the potential difference applied between the plates of each capacitor. Which of the following correctly ranks the electric potential energies <math alttext="U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="U sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> stored in capacitors <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="U sub 1 equals U sub 2, which equals U sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, U sub 1 equals U sub 3, close parenthesis, which is greater than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="U sub 3 is greater than open parenthesis, U sub 1 equals U sub 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="U sub 3 is greater than U sub 1, which is greater than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="U sub 3 is greater than U sub 1, which is greater than U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
